title: Dr. Peter Kreeft - The Philosophy of Thomas Aquinas
description:
Dr. Peter Kreeft - The Philosophy of Thomas Aquinas (The Modern Scholar) [14-part audio course + PDF course guide]

An enthusiastic admirer of the philosophy of Thomas Aquinas, professor and philosopher Peter Kreeft details the rational thought and precise literary talent that established Aquinas as the foremost thinker of his time - and as the most important philosopher for the almost 200 years between Aristotle and Descartes.

A landmark of philosophical achievement, Aquinas's Summa Theologica has given theologians and philosophers much to discuss since the 13th century. Peter Kreeft explains why.

Lecture 01 - AquinasÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Importance and a Short Biography
Lecture 02 - Philosophy and Theology, Reason and Faith
Lecture 03 - Can You Prove GodÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Existence
Lecture 04 - The Case Against AquinasÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s God and Proofs
Lecture 05 - Our Knowledge of and Language About God
Lecture 06 - What Is God- The Divine Attributes
Lecture 07 - AquinasÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Cosmology- Creation, Providence, and Free Will
Lecture 08 - AquinasÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Metaphysics
Lecture 09 - AquinasÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Philosophical Anthropology
Lecture 10 - AquinasÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Epistemology
Lecture 11 - AquinasÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ethics- What Is the Greatest Good
Lecture 12 - AquinasÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ethics- Right and Wrong
Lecture 13 - Aquinas on Law
Lecture 14 - Aquinas and Modern Philosophy
